verses.verse: To the chief <S%H5329><s%> Musician <S%H5329><s%> upon Shoshannimeduth, <S%H7802><s%> A Psalm <S%H4210><s%> of Asaph. <S%H623><s%> Give ear, <S%H238><s%> O Shepherd <S%H7462><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> you that lead <S%H5090><s%> Joseph <S%H3130><s%> like a flock; <S%H6629><s%> you that dwell <S%H3427><s%> between the cherubim, <S%H3742><s%> shine <S%H3313><s%> forth.
Before <S%H6440><s%> Ephraim <S%H669><s%> and Benjamin <S%H1144><s%> and Manasseh <S%H4519><s%> stir <S%H5782><s%> up your strength, <S%H1369><s%> and come <S%H3212><s%> and save <S%H3444><s%> us.
Turn <S%H7725><s%> us again, <S%H7725><s%> O God, <S%H430><s%> and cause your face <S%H6440><s%> to shine; <S%H215><s%> and we shall be saved. <S%H3467><s%>
O LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> of hosts, <S%H6635><s%> how <S%H5704><s%> long <S%H5704><s%> will you be angry <S%H6225><s%> against the prayer <S%H8605><s%> of your people? <S%H5971><s%>
You feed <S%H398><s%> them with the bread <S%H3899><s%> of tears; <S%H1832><s%> and give them tears <S%H1832><s%> to drink <S%H8248><s%> in great <S%H7991><s%> measure. <S%H7991><s%>
You make <S%H7760><s%> us a strife <S%H4066><s%> to our neighbors: <S%H7934><s%> and our enemies <S%H341><s%> laugh <S%H3932><s%> among themselves.
Turn <S%H7725><s%> us again, <S%H7725><s%> O God <S%H430><s%> of hosts, <S%H6635><s%> and cause your face <S%H6440><s%> to shine; <S%H215><s%> and we shall be saved. <S%H3467><s%>
You have brought <S%H5265><s%> a vine <S%H1612><s%> out of Egypt: <S%H4714><s%> you have cast <S%H1644><s%> out the heathen, <S%H1471><s%> and planted <S%H5193><s%> it.
You prepared <S%H6437><s%> room before <S%H6440><s%> it, and did cause it to take deep <S%H8328><s%> root, <S%H8327><s%> and it filled <S%H4390><s%> the land. <S%H776><s%>
The hills <S%H2022><s%> were covered <S%H3680><s%> with the shadow <S%H6738><s%> of it, and the boughs <S%H6057><s%> thereof were like the goodly <S%H410><s%> cedars. <S%H730><s%>
She sent <S%H7971><s%> out her boughs <S%H7105><s%> to the sea, <S%H3220><s%> and her branches <S%H3127><s%> to the river. <S%H5104><s%>
Why <S%H4100><s%> have you then broken <S%H6555><s%> down her hedges, <S%H1447><s%> so that all <S%H3605><s%> they which pass <S%H5674><s%> by the way <S%H1870><s%> do pluck <S%H717><s%> her?
The boar <S%H2386><s%> out of the wood <S%H3293><s%> does waste <S%H3765><s%> it, and the wild <S%H2123><s%> beast <S%H2123><s%> of the field <S%H7704><s%> does devour <S%H7462><s%> it.

Return, <S%H7725><s%> we beseech <S%H4994><s%> you, O God <S%H430><s%> of hosts: <S%H6635><s%> look <S%H5027><s%> down from heaven, <S%H8064><s%> and behold, <S%H7200><s%> and visit <S%H6485><s%> this <S%H2063><s%> vine; <S%H1612><s%>
And the vineyard <S%H3657><s%> which <S%H834><s%> your right <S%H3225><s%> hand <S%H3225><s%> has planted, <S%H5193><s%> and the branch <S%H1121><s%> that you made strong <S%H553><s%> for yourself.
It is burned <S%H8313><s%> with fire, <S%H784><s%> it is cut <S%H3683><s%> down: they perish <S%H6><s%> at the rebuke <S%H1606><s%> of your countenance. <S%H6440><s%>
Let your hand <S%H3027><s%> be on the man <S%H376><s%> of your right <S%H3225><s%> hand, <S%H3225><s%> on the son <S%H1121><s%> of man <S%H120><s%> whom you made strong <S%H553><s%> for yourself.
So will not we go <S%H5472><s%> back <S%H5472><s%> from you: quicken <S%H2421><s%> us, and we will call <S%H7121><s%> on your name. <S%H8034><s%>
Turn <S%H7725><s%> us again, <S%H7725><s%> O LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> of hosts, <S%H6635><s%> cause your face <S%H6440><s%> to shine; <S%H215><s%> and we shall be saved. <S%H3467><s%>
